Fields

Data

The waterfall bin data

public ushort[] Data

Field Value

ushort[]

FirstBinIndex

The index of the first bin in the tile. If a full frame was split across multiple packets/tiles, this would tell you which set of data it represented in the frame. For example, if a Frame had 1300 bins in it, it could get split across 3 packets/tiles. These tiles might have FirstBinIndex values of 0, 500, and 1000 (last packet containing only 300 bins). Note that the Timecode and FrameLowFreq would be the same for all 3 of these packets.

public uint FirstBinIndex

Field Value

uint

TotalBinsInFrame

The total number of FFT points (bins) in the frame. Note that if the data was split across multiple packets, this number may not match the length of the Data field

public uint TotalBinsInFrame

Field Value

uint

Properties

AutoBlackLevel

The level to use if Auto Black is enabled (for automatically setting the 'noise floor' of the display)

public uint AutoBlackLevel { get; set; }

Property Value

uint

BinBandwidth

The "width" represented by each Bin. For example, a 1MHz waterfall display with 4096 bins would have a BinBandwidth of ~244Hz.

public VitaFrequency BinBandwidth { get; set; }

Property Value

VitaFrequency

DateTime

The arrival timestamp of the packet (UTC)

public DateTime DateTime { get; set; }

Property Value

DateTime

FrameLowFreq

The frequency represented by the first bin in the frame (note: the frame could be spread across multiple packets feeding this object)

public VitaFrequency FrameLowFreq { get; set; }

Property Value

VitaFrequency

Height

The number of bins tall described by the tile

public ushort Height { get; set; }

Property Value

ushort

IsFrameComplete

If the WaterfallTile is spread across multiple packets, this property will be false until a complete frames data has arrived

public bool IsFrameComplete { get; set; }

Property Value

bool

LineDurationMS

The length of time represented by the tile in milliseconds. Faster update rates will result in lower line durations. For example, a rate that yields 10 frames per second would have a line duration of 100ms. A faster rate might yield 20 frames per second and would have a duration of 50ms.

public uint LineDurationMS { get; set; }

Property Value

uint

Timecode

An index relating the Tile to a relative time base

public uint Timecode { get; set; }

Property Value

uint

Width

The number of bins wide described by the tile

public ushort Width { get; set; }

Property Value

ushort
